snippet: A report on a fatal yacht crash during a race off the San Francisco coast in April said it was “troubling” that other competitors did not stop to help the foundering yacht.
abstract: United States Sailing report on fatal yacht crash during a race off the San Francisco coast in April finds that little could have been done to save the five crew members who drowned, but calls it 'troubling' that other competitors did not stop to help the foundering yacht.
lead_paragraph: A report on a fatal yacht crash during a race off the San Francisco coast in April said it was “troubling” that other competitors did not stop to help the foundering yacht.

headline.main: Report Calls Lack of Assistance After Fatal Yacht Crash ‘Troubling’
headline.print_headline: Report Calls Lack of Assistance After Fatal Crash ‘Troubling’
